snippet: Chinese security officials have issued a wanted list of six suspected members of a militant group that they said is using a number of Asian nations as staging grounds for terror attacks.
abstract: Chinese security officials issue a wanted list of six members of East Turkestan Islamic Movement; they claim the group is using a number of Asian nations as staging grounds for terror attacks in western Chinese region of Xinjiang; group claimed responsibility for a series of attacks in July 2011 that were apparently mounted by Islamic separatists protesting the heavy-handed rule of Uighurs by China's Han majority and seeking Independence for what they call East Turkestan.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Michael Wines reported from Beijing, and Declan Walsh from Islamabad, Pakistan. Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Chinese security officials have issued a wanted list of six suspected members of a militant group that they said is using a number of Asian nations as staging grounds for terror attacks.

headline.seo: China Says Uighurs Attack From Nearby Countries
headline.main: China Says Wanted Militants Use Nearby Countries to Stage Attacks
headline.print_headline: China Says Militants Use Its Neighbors As Base Camp
